org.jgrapes.core.annotation

Annotation Type Handler


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface Handler
    Marks a method as handler for events. The method is invoked for events that have a type (or name) matching the given events (or namedEvents) parameter and that are fired on the given channels (or namedChannels).
    Author:
    Michael N. Lipp

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends Channel>[] channels
      Specifies classes of channels that the handler listens on.
      java.lang.Class<? extends Event>[] events
      Specifies classes of events that the handler is to receive.
      java.lang.String[] namedChannels
      Specifies names of NamedChannels that the handler listens on.
      java.lang.String[] namedEvents
      Specifies names of NamedEvents that the handler is to receive.
      int priority
      Specifies a priority.

    • Element Detail

      • events

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Event>[] events
        Specifies classes of events that the handler is to receive.
        Default:
        org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler.NO_EVENT.class

      • namedEvents

        public abstract java.lang.String[] namedEvents
        Specifies names of NamedEvents that the handler is to receive.
        Default:
        ""

      • channels

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends Channel>[] channels
        Specifies classes of channels that the handler listens on.
        Default:
        org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler.NO_CHANNEL.class

      • namedChannels

        public abstract java.lang.String[] namedChannels
        Specifies names of NamedChannels that the handler listens on.
        Default:
        ""

      • priority

        public abstract int priority
        Specifies a priority. The value is used to sort handlers. Handlers with higher priority are invoked first.
        Default:
        0
